result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick Robert Peters

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Derrick Robert Peters.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. For reasons stated on the record, defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to be monitored by drug testing. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Derrick Robert Peters.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. This hearing may be streamed live at the discretion of the Court via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters not in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait appeared by video for Derrick Robert Peters.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER. Court further takes no action as to bail.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Case set for a scheduling conference on 7/29/22 at 8:30 am. Court is down and unable to hear the matter. Case is rescheduled to 9/2/22 at 10:30 am. Parties notified via email.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Student Intern Jessica Birmingham under the supervision of Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel needs a global offer from the State and requests an additional scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Lisa M Valenti-Jordan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held.  Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  This hearing may be streamed live via https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/c105c3fe-89b8-5d05-5f8c-b6cf0d4921da  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Derrick Robert Peters in court.  Matthew Richard Westphal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge  Kiefer, Branch 29.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 29 for a Pretrial Conference.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with EJK
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/25/2022@1pm
